question.query: pull the top latest tweets in crypto - what are the key discussions, projects, and narratives? Assess the sentiment and importance of each

steps.text:
Here’s a fast snapshot of what Crypto Twitter is focused on in the last 48–72 hours, with representative tweets/sources, plus my take on sentiment and importance.

1) X/CT algorithm chaos and bot flood
- What happened: A surge of spam/bots after an X algorithm change triggered a CT-wide backlash and debate with X’s Head of Product.
- Representative tweets:
  - Ki Young Ju (CryptoQuant): traffic spike/bot flood noted on-chain/CT metrics: https://x.com/ki_young_ju/status/2010133579268067351
  - Thread involving X Head of Product Nikita Bier via @incognitoison: https://x.com/incognitoison/status/2009838378385015115
- Coverage: Protos summary of the meltdown: https://protos.com/crypto-twitter-melts-down-after-algorithm-change-triggers-x-bot-flood
- Sentiment: Negative/concerned (spam, discovery issues, scam surface area).
- Importance: High. Impacts crypto information flow, retail engagement, and scam exposure.

2) X to add “crypto‑aware” Smart Cashtags
- What happened: X’s Head of Product teased crypto-aware Smart Cashtags coming as early as February after CT backlash.
- Source: CoinDesk: https://www.coindesk.com/tech/2026/01/11/x-s-head-of-product-teases-crypto-aware-smart-cashtags-one-day-after-crypto-twitter-backlash
- Sentiment: Cautiously positive (could improve discovery and reduce spam if done right).
- Importance: Medium–High for user experience, price discovery, and brand perception on CT.

3) Macro/flows: fading Fed cut hopes and crypto ETP outflows
- What happened: $454M in outflows from crypto ETPs amid retreating rate-cut expectations; weekly macro watch on BTC.
- Sources:
  - Cointelegraph outflows: https://cointelegraph.com/news/crypto-etp-454-million-outflows-fed-rate-cut-hopes-fade
  - Week-ahead macro for BTC: https://cointelegraph.com/news/fed-rate-cuts-under-fire-5-things-bitcoin-this-week
- Sentiment: Bearish-to-cautious across CT; risk-off undertone.
- Importance: High. Flows drive near-term price action and sentiment.

4) Markets divergence: metals at highs, crypto flat
- What happened: Gold/silver rallying while crypto stagnates; CT discussing rotation and relative strength.
- Source: The Defiant: https://thedefiant.io/news/markets/crypto-markets-flat-metals-rally-jan-12-2026
- Sentiment: Slightly bearish/frustrated for crypto.
- Importance: Medium (macro cross-asset lens).

5) Privacy coin narrative: Monero (XMR) ATH
- What happened: XMR hit a record; privacy thesis resurfaces on CT (dystopian/financial privacy arguments).
- Source: DLNews: https://www.dlnews.com/articles/markets/monero-xmr-token-hits-record-price-as-investors-pile-into-privacy-crypto
- Sentiment: Bullish for privacy sector; some regulatory caution in replies.
- Importance: Medium. Signals rotation into privacy themes and niche outperformance.

6) Whale/miner activity: early “Satoshi-era” miner moved ~$181M BTC
- What happened: On-chain analysts flagged large, old coins moving; often sparks CT debate about distribution and tops/bottoms.
- Source referencing the tweet by CryptoQuant’s Julio Moreno (@jjcmoreno): https://www.dlnews.com/articles/markets/bitcoin-miner-moves-181-million
- Sentiment: Mixed/alert; traders watch for sell pressure but evidence of actual selling is debated.
- Importance: Medium (good for short-term narrative and on-chain watchers).

7) ETH outperformance narrative into 2030
- What happened: Standard Chartered note circulating on CT expecting ETH to outperform BTC and potentially reach $40k by 2030, tied to onchain finance adoption.
- Source: DLNews: https://www.dlnews.com/articles/markets/why-ethereum-will-outperform-bitcoin-by-2030-according-to-standard-chartered
- Sentiment: Bullish ETH; some BTC maxis skeptical; constructive engagement from DeFi/RWA accounts.
- Importance: Medium. Long-dated, but influences positioning and narrative skew on CT.

8) “Debasement trade” renewed
- What happened: Analysts’ takes spreading on CT that US dollar weakness and policy will push BTC higher.
- Source: DLNews: https://www.dlnews.com/articles/markets/bitcoin-price-to-surge-as-trump-runs-debasement-trade-into-overdrive
- Sentiment: Bullish BTC macro; classic “digital gold” framing resurfaces.
- Importance: Medium. Macro thesis that underpins hodler conviction and institutional messaging.

9) Security/scams: Betterment breach, fake crypto promo
- What happened: Betterment confirmed a third-party communications breach; users received scammy “triple your crypto” promos. CT amplified security warnings.
- Sources:
  - TechCrunch: https://techcrunch.com/2026/01/12/fintech-firm-betterment-confirms-data-breach-after-hackers-send-fake-crypto-scam-notification-to-users
  - News pickup: https://www.tradingview.com/news/cointelegraph:fa46a87d0094b:0-betterment-urges-users-to-ignore-unauthorized-crypto-promotion-message
- Sentiment: Negative/alert; strong warnings from security-focused accounts.
- Importance: High for retail protection and platform trust.

10) Memecoin fatigue: record token failures
- What happened: CT sharing stats that 2025 saw massive token failures, with memecoins hit hardest; rekindles quality vs. gamble debate.
- Source: https://cointelegraph.com/news/crypto-project-failures-record-2025-memecoin-turbulence
- Sentiment: Bearish on low-quality launches; cautious rotation to quality narratives.
- Importance: Medium. Shifts retail behavior and appetite for risk.

How I’d weight narratives today
- High importance: X/CT algorithm + Smart Cashtags; Macro/ETP flows; Security/scams.
- Medium importance: Privacy coins (XMR), Whale/miner moves, ETH outperformance thesis, Debasement trade, Metals vs crypto divergence, Memecoin fatigue.

Want me to keep a rolling list of the most-engaged CT posts each day (with direct tweet links and engagement stats) and send you a brief daily brief? I can also bias toward specific sectors (DeFi, RWA, L2s, AI x crypto, gaming) if you tell me your focus.

parameters.query: site:x.com crypto (airdrop OR ETF OR hack OR exploit OR meme) since:2026-01-10

standardAgentConfig.instructions:
Role: crypto research assistant

        Tools: 'webSearch'

        Utilize web search capabilities to find accurate, current information about crypto projects, trends, and markets.

        Your objective is to be a user's crypto research assistant. Answer the user's question as best as you can
